Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Wild Goat style pottery bowl; inside, black glazed with two friezes of polychrome incised lotus and bud decoration with broad red band lined in white between; exterior, from above, maeander frieze; band with added red band lined in white; frieze of goats to right (parts of two preserved) with rosette and dot fill
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 6, N 17, pl. 1, N 17)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 48-9, no. 5)
CVA Musée Scheurleer II (Hague) / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Pays-Bas Musée Scheurleer (p. 1 II D, nos 5-6, pl. 1, nos 5-6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.473)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2477 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
